result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Robert Fontaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to 22CM03, 21CF214, 21CM98, and 21CM97 and to any other sentence

Def to report to the DOC in Ashland w/in 48 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment.

Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations. . 
Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling. 
Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ B.J. unless she consents in writing, approved by DOC, and completes Domestic Violence Counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Robert Fontaine

records.addlTxt: 8:00 AM Defendant Joseph Robert Fontaine appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Joseph Robert Fontaine.  Cases 22CM1, 20CM153, 21CM97, 21CF214, 21CM98, 22CM58, and 22CM3.  21CM153, DEJ is revoked.  Parties have agreement.  21CM98 talked about restitution at last hearing, 20CM153 there was a restitution request and was incorporated in part of the DEJ, 2/5 a bill and amended restitution, is there a request still.  State comments was in DEJ but subsequently the request is being waived, no request.  State has complied with victim rights.  State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments on sentencing.   Def makes a statement.  See attached Offer to Schedule for sentencing.  On expungement, if completes probation completing all of the condition with no other cases, with the exception of 21CM98 and 22CM58, court finds that def was under age of 25 on remaining cases, can be expunged.
Sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 08:00 am.

9:59 AM Defendant Joseph Robert Fontaine appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Joseph Robert Fontaine.  Not on the record.  Only one PLQ filed, in case 22CM58, missing counts, and not completed.  Def has a copy of the PLQ in front of him.  On the record 10:03 cases 20CM153, 21CF214, 21CM97, 21CM98, 22CM01, 22CM03, and 22CM58.  22CM03 CT 2 States says DRI, another issue PLQ filed is to relate to all cases and in the first portion about the pleas and charges, but agreement is different.  Off the record.  Back on the record 10:06  PLQ the two empty boxes, def agrees that him and attorney have talked about this.  Document 15 in 22CM58, proposing to write in, and rescan in document with correct information with it, def and attorney ok with court judge changing to no contest and adding other charges.  To be scanned and filed in all cases with exception of 20CM153.  File in 21CM98 contains restitution request that is not in offer, State there is a request, attorney there is a stipulation for restitution, def agrees.  21CM153 on 4/18 the motion to vacate was not opposed, judgment never granted, was supposed to happen on 6/7, ORDERING judgment to enter on both cases now.  
Parties have agreement.  Attorneys request breakout room at 10:21.  Back on the record at 10:23.  State stipulation for attorney to argue expungement exception to cases 22CM58 and 21CM98.  Def and attorney in break out room.  Back on the record 10:29.  Attorney and def are prepared to go forward.  State has complied with victim rights.  A victim is present in the hearing, no victim wishes to address the court.  Back on the record 10:33.  Def waives right to personal appearance, discussed with attorney.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right to personal appearance, court accepts waiver to personal appearance.  Attorney and def admit that it is an act of domestic abuse.  Def understands charges and penalties, and elements.  Attorney def PLEADS NO CONTEST to the nine counts.  PLQ, reviewed with attorney, understands information, and additional information added today, and rights giving up.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently making pleas, and accepts NO CONTEST PLEAS.  In each case, as a factual basis can court rely on the complaint, parties agree, court finds factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter, all other counts DRI.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:00 am.

01:02 PM 20CM153, 21CF214, 21CM97, 21CM98, 22CM1, 22CM3 & 22CM58 Defendant Joseph Robert Fontaine in court from ACJ with attorney Thomas Locante.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. State commenting -- withdrawing Motion to Modify Bond. -- noted. 22CM58 -- Initial Appr -- have rec copy of criminal complaint, waives reading of complaint and stand mute. Clerk to enter NGP to all eight counts. 21CM97 & 21CM98 -- Motion for Joinder cases -- State commenting on joinder cases. If court grants motion to join two cases, filing another acts of motion in underlying cases. State has been discussing agreement now that Initial has been filed in newest case, State willing to ask for an adjournment for a global resolution. Attorney commenting on cases -- no objecting to motion for joinder --- agree w/ discussion about a global resolution. Court orders: Motion for Joinder in 21CM97 & 21CM98 -- if trial is set, cases are joined for trial -- Motion for Joinder granted. State commenting on PSI. Adjourn remaining cases -- 22CM1, 22CM3, and 20CM153. If no agreement, schedule trial in joinder cases and possibly others. Attorney commenting -- if no resolution by next hearing, Attorney may file a motion to modify bond. Schedule all cases for a STC on 6/27/22 @ 1:00 PM. All parties can appear via Zoom for next hearing. Clerk to set Def up to appear via Zoom from ACJ.
